Title: Energy digital twins in smart manufacturing systems: A case study
Abstract summary: The paper presents a case study of an energy digital twin for a smart manufacturing system that optimizes energy consumption through bidirectional communication between the physical and virtual systems.

Title: Digital twin in energy industry: Proposed robust digital twin for power plant and other complex capital-intensive large engineering systems
Authors: Ahmad K. Sleiti, J. Kapat, L. Vesely
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a comprehensive and robust digital twin architecture for power plants and other complex capital-intensive engineering systems, but does not address agent communication protocols or modeling human expertise.

Title: Towards Fusing Data and Expert Knowledge for Better-Informed Digital Twins: An Initial Framework
Abstract summary: The paper proposes a framework for integrating expert knowledge and data to improve data-driven Digital Twin models, but does not specifically address agent communication protocols or the energy sector.

Title: Digital Twins’ Applications for Building Energy Efficiency: A Review
Authors: Rafaela Bortolini, R. Rodrigues, Hamid Alavi, Luisa Felix Dalla Vecchia, N. Forcada
Abstract summary: This paper reviews the applications of digital twins for building energy efficiency, but does not address the use of agent communication protocols to model human expertise for digital twins in the energy sector.

Title: Digital Twin Framework for Energy Efficient Greenhouse Industry 4.0
Authors: D. A. Howard, Zheng Ma, B. Jørgensen
Abstract summary: This paper introduces a digital twin framework using multi-agent systems to optimize greenhouse production, but does not address research gaps in using agent communication protocols to model human expertise for digital twins in the energy sector.

Title: Digital twin in battery energy storage systems: Trends and gaps detection through association rule mining
Authors: C. Semeraro, H. Aljaghoub, M. Abdelkareem, A. Alami, A. Olabi
Abstract summary: This paper does not address the use of agent communication protocols to model human expertise for digital twins in the energy sector. It focuses on the trends and gaps in digital twin technology for battery energy storage systems.

Title: A review on digital twins for power generation and distribution
Abstract summary: This paper reviews digital twin applications in the energy sector, but does not specifically address using agent communication protocols to model human expertise.

Title: Agent-Based Modelling of Urban District Energy System Decarbonisation – A Systematic Literature Review
Authors: A. Akhatova, L. Kranzl, F. Schipfer, Charitha Buddhika Heendeniya
Abstract summary: The paper is not directly relevant to the query, as it focuses on agent-based modeling of urban district energy system decarbonization, rather than using agent communication protocols to model human expertise for digital twins in the energy sector.
